availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Aaron Theodore Supplee (Johnson County, Indiana, day laborer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Indiana, day laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of David Supplee and Sarah A. Supplee. Attended school in Carroll County, Kentucky, in 1850. Day laborer in Johnson County, Indiana, in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861 to January 12, 1865. Wounded at the Battle of Huff's Ferry, Roane County, Tennessee on November 14, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 2, p. 162B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Edinburgh, p. 596.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0268.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 870.
"Aaron Theodore Supplee (1839-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial 35354574, accessed December 12, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35354574.
